page.title: 12The Handicapped in Ryhope
page.content: Sunelm House is a big place and many people work there.It is on{Leechmere {Industrial Estate.}The people who work there are blind, deaf and dumb and mentally{handicapped.}The things they make are furniture and clothes. The people come from the{Sunderland}area. There is another one like it in the north east; it is in Washington. They get to the factory by bus although some of them use cars. The blind people make furniture.All of them like working there and they make about nine things. The factory has been built ten years and has six work rooms which are quite big. It has one floor and it has not any stairs at all. The youngest person in the factory is sixteen; she has been working there for six months. It is run by the{Social Services}and the{Blind Institute}and is open to the general public twice a year.
